ygData.subject: Am I gonna die?
ygData.msgSnippet: Does anyone know what happens when your account runs out? Mine is set to expire October 1st (I started a six-month account on April 1st), and I haven t heard
ygData.messageBody:
Does anyone know what happens when your account runs out? Mine is set to
expire October 1st (I started a six-month account on April 1st), and I
haven't heard anything from our kind and intelligent friends at Verant.
If I decide not to play EQ any more, or just quit for a while, will my
character be deleted/wiped? If so, then I'd better get on the ball and
start giving my stuff away. It seems like a waste, though. Cause I'll
probably come back in a couple months to play again, and I don't want to
have to start over. But I also don't want to keep paying the monthly fee
if I'm not gonna be online.

Saidinn Witchwood

-----Original Message-----
From: Jeff Habermann [mailto:jrhabermann@...]
Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 3:04 PM
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light


From: Jeff Habermann <jrhabermann@...>

Thanks for all the help. I am level 15, so should i not worry about
this
weapon or should i still go for it?


----- Original Message -----
From: Curtis Bennett <die_kluge@...>
To: <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, September 21, 1999 12:29 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ-Clerics] Shining Star of Light


> From: "Curtis Bennett" <die_kluge@...>
>
> <slight spoiler warning>
>
> I think the important thing to remember about the SSOL is that it's
> a fairly low-level item. Most clerics will toss it once they get a
> screaming mace, or a BEM, or gem-encrusted scepter. Because the quest
> doesn't involves only killing bixies in Rivervale you can do this
> quest at an extremely low level. I did the blessed oil quest over
> and over again. It took me about 15 times or more of doing this. I
> am a high elf, and I think I was apprehensive when I started. Maybe
> dubious, I don't remember. You have to get well into amiably to get
> the quest.
> Another really good quest that I'm doing now in my spare time is the
> diseased wolf quest. You can kill rabid wolves and rabid grizzlies
> in Qeynos hills and give the pelts to Priestess Caulria in the UFO.
> I turned in 4 wolf pelts and 1 grizzly pelt, got a plat for the
> grizzly pelt, and 'endure disease' a 14th level spell (which you can
> buy for 4 plat, or sell for 6-7 gold). I turned in these pelts, and
> at 15th level, I got nearly a half a bar of experience. Not bad
> considering 90% of rabid wolves die with one smite spell.
>
> >
> >From: "Heather Daley" <blushn@...>
> >
> >Our guildmaster, who is a paladin, just recently needed to raise his
> >faction
> >with the priests of Life, in order to obtain his soulfire sword.
> >Basically what we did to help raise his faction was:
> >1) killing putrid skellies in South Karana(at Grimrots Camp)
> >2) Turning in diseased animal pelts to the Temple of Life
> >3) Doing the Blessed oil Quest til he turned green
> >
> >These will all raise your faction there. Even I, a person who originally
> >came from the temple of Life, needed to raise my faction in order to do
the
> >quest. But to be quite honest, I did the quest simply cause I had never
> >done
> >a quest before, I tried the weapon out like once to see what the effect
was
> >and it has sat in the bank ever since.
> >
> >Bree Wyndsdale
> >47th Cleric of Fennin Ro
> >
> >
> >
> >>From: Jeff Habermann <jrhabermann@...>
> >>
> >>I keep reading that everyone on here loves to use there SSOL. I would
> >>like
> >>to get this weapon as well. I am a human cleric from the Temple of Marr
> >>in
> >>Freeport. Will i have problems trying to do the quest, or will i be ok?
> >>Just want to make sure, before I make that loooong journy from freeport
to
> >>qeynos. Thanks
>
>
